title: Doubles Storytelling
plot: About a month ago, my noisy little brain spat out something it named RPG1 in a desperate and somewhat-misguided attempt to keep sane.  All its parts are randomly-generated, and the stories (if they can be called that) one can experience while playing it are similarly random.

title: Doubles Storytelling
plot: So naturally, after the several seconds of relief that accompany the release of something I've created, my brain turned to what to do for RPG2.

title: Doubles Storytelling
plot: I've made a lot of silly little games, but none of them have been for multiple players.  It felt like time to change that.  I've also been hankering, for whatever reason, to do some old-fashioned storytelling.  The imagination paints scenes more beautifully than even the highest production values can manage.  At the same time, there's something wildly satisfying about using bottle caps and salt shakers to represent parties and landmarks.  Low-fidelity, abstract visuals meet vivid story possibilities.  The telling and authorship of the tale should be the actual game mechanic.  We consume so much more than we create now, and that can't be healthy.

title: Doubles Storytelling
plot: So there we have it.  It was time to make a Reciprocative Penning Game for 2 players.  Sign in, find a partner, and take turns adding a bit of story.  Blocky little symbols (and the return of random generated shapes from RPG1) can be arranged on small, abstract scenes for quick little illustrations.  To make it a bit of a game, I've set it up so that players can mark each others' latest addition as "awesome".  The ability to use "The End" and finish the story is unlocked after enough of that positive feedback has been exchanged.

title: Doubles Storytelling
plot: And that's that.  It's even less fancy than RPG1, but it's fun to sign in with a friend and create some stories together.  It's exactly as serious or as fast-paced or as filled with flowery prose as the two who are playing together.  I am curious what kinds of stories people will tell with it, but I refuse to capture that data on the server since it feels like since it feels like snooping.

title: Doubles Storytelling
plot: As always, this is free and open, so everyone is encouraged to run their own servers and make their own changes.  The world seems hell-bent on taking power and agency away from people, so by reflex I intend to spread what little I can.
